Authors:
Teresa Iturriaga, Katherine F LoBuglio, Donald H.
Pfister
Title:
On Bulgariella pulla, another Leotiomycete of questionable
placement.
Keywords:
Helotiales, Leotiomycetes, ascus dehiscence, taxonomy,
phylogeny
Abstract:
A seldomcollected fungus; Bulgariella pulla
(Leotiomycetes) is redescribed to include characters of the ascus,
spores and habitat that were previously not considered. Lagerheima
sphaerospora (≡ Bulgariella sphaerospora, type species of the genus
Lagerheima) proves to be conspecific with Bulgariella pulla, holotype of
Bulgariella. Thus, Bulgariella remains as a monotypic genus. Asci of B.
pulla lack a pore and open by forming valves. This is an unusual feature
in the Leotiomycetes. Phylogenetic analyses of the 5.8S, large, and
small subunit rDNA show that Bulgariella has an uncertain position
within the Leotiomycetes, its placement under any of the families or
clades of that order is yet to be defined.
